intro: Asterochlaena hieronymi var. latiphylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed asterochlaena, is a rare and distinctive member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to specific regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the late spring. Its foliage is often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, textured appearance. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
